body: Agree, maybe we can post it into posgresql mail list for further discussion.
I chatted with Roman on this issue.  We have conflicting priorities which are causing us to rethink the inclusion of Thrift in the source base.
Overall LGTM, but I'd like to spend more time reviewing. This is a lot of code
Great to see s3 works with HAWQ now!
LGTM except the three comments. Thanks ðŸŽ±
Per disscusion, @rvs is going through the Apache crypto process, and we could check in the code at first.
Huge effort for this and good to have them in +1
This has been merged to master (https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/commit/72ea8afd7e17b4777bef9a4f75b8691570cc92c7)
Please close this pull request and related JIRA(HAWQ-960), thanks.
+1. Great work and I like the commit info in this pull request ðŸ‘
Hi paul, could you describe the cases of this bug? Thanks.

They (libhdfs and libyarn) should  be built under $top_builddir (build
path), although
current we have the build path identical as the source path.

2016-09-07 18:26 GMT+08:00 Hong Wu notifications@github.com:

> Hi paul, could you describe the cases of this bug? Thanks.
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/pull/893#issuecomment-245239411,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AHI5jM2GvnD61m6YWjdmQedl0ucOWuxeks5qnpFEgaJpZM4J2wvn
> .
I will be sending a new PR with HAWQ-971 branch. All the above CR fixes will go into that.
Can you remove all references to `Vectorized` Hive classes since they are not yet being used
You need to update README.md to reflect the change and system requirement.
I'd suggest moving the test cases to src/test/feature (googletest framework) in this change or in other changes.
@paul-guo- is it a simple move or re-write?
